help.trackcontrols: You can work with track using following controls:
help.tracklock: — lock Root key and Accidentals to composition settings
help.keyboardtip: When live keyboard playback is on — the last selected instrument will be used to play notes as you press buttons on your keyboard. It would also be highlighted with a colored outline.
help.accidentalstextone: Playable set consists of 7 notes based on the Root key.
help.accidentalstexttwo: By default they form what is called a Major Scale.
help.accidentalstextthree: Accidentals can alter scale by moving each note a semi-tone up or down independantly.
help.sharetextone: When you share a composition with somebody — you send them a link with your complete composition encoded in it.
help.sharetexttwo: That means if they will then edit it — it will not affect your project or saved composition.
help.sharetextthree: Same goes for your changes — old link would still lead to an old version of the project.
help.savetextone: The projects are saved in your browser local storage.
help.savetexttwo: They will never expire and you can edit or listen to them any time.
help.savetextthree: If you want to be able to access your composition using a different machine or browser — you can use the link from Share window.
help.featuredtextone: Here you can find featured examples of what can be created using Chant.
help.featuredtexttwo: Want to share your composition with the world? Head to "Information" section to find out how to contact us.
help.notestextone: Here you can add metadata to your composition and decide whether it should be displayed right away when somebody you shared a composition with opens it.

dialog.download: Downloading a recording requires you to playback your composition.
dialog.link: The address for this composition is incorrect. This could happen if the link was trimmed, VK.com is known to do that. Try copying and pasting the link directly into address bar.

popup.accidentalstip: Select Accidentals for each of the 7 steps of the scale (notes used are represented on the piano octave above, press the keys to hear sound).
popup.nosaved: You don't have any compositions saved yet
popup.name: Enter a name
popup.title: Title
popup.author: Author
popup.sharetext: Share Chant on your favorite social network:
popup.failed: Your browser does not support copying, please manually copy the selected link
popup.link: Copy the link above to manually share your composition.
popup.sharetip: If you want to share your composition by manually copying link use link shortener like
popup.howtextone: Chant uses English musical notation with letters A to G and parses provided text in search of those letter if you use 'C' Root key setting and no accidentals. If you change Root key or add accidentals - Chant would still use the same letters but the notes they represent would change.
popup.howtexttwo: Capital letters are played one octave above and first letter since the last word break is played one octave below.
popup.howtextthree: Using this knowledge you can try to create controlled compositions or you could just paste some text to get seemingly random patterns. Text with repetitions should sound best.
popup.creditstexttwo: , a front end web developer and a member of electronic duo
popup.creditstextfive: Feel free to drop us a word at
popup.code: All about the code? You're welcome to have a look at Chant source code on
popup.firefox: Firefox is pretty bad at displaying complex 3D styles. It is recommended to use Chant in Chrome for smoothest experience.

error.title: Error
error.storage: Your local storage limit has exceeded, try removing old compositions.

ui.howto: Whenever you see this icon — you can press it for contextual help
ui.noletters: At least one entry of any of the following letters is required in any track: C, D, E, F, G, A, B (capital or lowercase). Click Information in the menu for more details.

chant.placeholder: Place any English text here and hit Play. Tip: select a character to start playback from it.
chant.octave: Octave shift (values from -5 to 5 are allowed)
